p:
Employment of known G4 ligands has provided interesting insights in the regulation of HSV-1 G4s, first and foremost the reduction in virus replication, obtained after treatment with either BRACO-19 (IC 50 ~ 8 μM)
15 or a core-extended naphthalene diimide derivative (IC 50 ~ 18 nM).
19 Both compounds led to a significant reduction in viral DNA synthesis and late transcripts production. Furthermore, in vitro assays revealed the ability of G4 ligands to improve further HSV-1 G4s stability and their ability to stall polymerase progression.
